intro: Chrysocoma nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
